surface.zone: The first nations whose names ever are on record are Chaldea and India. Tradition has preserved wonderful accounts of their progress in astronomical science. To them we owe the Zodiac and many observations on the motions of the heavenly bodies w which argue a much more accurate knowledge of that art than any succeeding country could boast of u n p til the time of Galileo and Newton. But their wisdom passed away ‸ from the earth leaving but faint traces in among the Eyptians a race of men ???? whose minds appear to‸ have bear a considerable affinity with most those of the Chinese. Both these nations people arrived at a certain point in refinement and know ledge and remained fixed. Superstiti on and slavery clouded their perceptions and a hatred of innovation, the never-failing attendant on w mids a minds which have (changed to has) learnt every thing from imitation and no thing from itself, was the natural consequence of the govern arbitrary ? government they obeyed. Their history both on ac- count of its antiquity and the genius of the nation prevents little more than a list of m names. Pride and a love of Con quest was teh distinguishing characteristic of their kind? kings and they displayed their magnificance‸ was displayed either by‸ a bloody and useless con warfare on the liberties of their neighbours or by the de oppression and destruct destruction of their‸ own subjects employed in the building of those famous pyra mids, which, shap being scarcely more than shapless mazes of brick ‸or and stone, seem fitted to endure till the earth itself shall pass away. be no longer. Slavery The oppression of their own monarchs sovereigns fitted the necks of this people Egyptians for the yoke of a foreign prince after a few generations they were subdued and remained for ages swallowed up in the ‸great Persian monarchy till after the death of Alexander when they againx ????? became an independant nation till they fell with of overpowering force of the Roman Empire reduced‸them once more to the condition of a Province.
